node.title: How To Cure Olives
node.excerpt: I adore olives. So much so that I’ve planted three trees – Arbequina, Leccino, and a new cultivar called Universal out of the breeding program in Yalta, acquired via One Green World. node.title: In which I praise the glory of the little apple, manzanita

node.title: Big shoes to fill
node.excerpt: I called them my “freeway roses” and one time I had a conversation with my neighbor in which I told her I was thinking of removing them. She said (paraphrasing) “Noooo! They’re pretty!” They were. Sort of. The great things about Meidiland roses are: Need zero supplemental water, need no pruning, ever, they’re incredibly resistant […]

node.title: Then and Now
node.excerpt: I found some old pics. Enjoy! Clearly it’s a mess no matter what I do. Nonetheless, I think I like all of the “now” views better.

node.title: A Visit to Joy Creek

node.title: Introduction to Place Pigalle
node.excerpt: I’ve made promises to show you this wonderful garden, and finally, here we are.  Just the backyard today – there’s a lot going on!
